item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 24, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Those Correction Notices, in Full (82 points | 16 comments)
2. WireGuard: Beyond the Most Basic Configuration (54 points | 9 comments)
3. Mark–Scavenge: Waiting for Trash to Take Itself Out (39 points | 10 comments)
4. Hynix launches 321-layer NAND (6 points | discuss)
5. I made an ls alternative for my personal use it turned out to be amazing (49 points | 37 comments)
6. Full LLM training and evaluation toolkit (88 points | 4 comments)
7. NASA: Mystery of Life's Handedness Deepens (24 points | 10 comments)
8. Howstuffworks.com creator, Marshall Brain, has died (200 points | 51 comments)
9. Frosted Glass from Games to the Web: HTML glass UI inspired by AAA game dev (631 points | 147 comments)
10. History of Hangul (49 points | 24 comments)
11. The size of BYD's factory (55 points | 66 comments)
12. Petnames: A humane approach to secure, decentralized naming (37 points | 5 comments)
13. A career-ending mistake (252 points | 148 comments)
14. Linux 6.13 Will Report the Number of Hung Tasks Since Boot (80 points | 9 comments)
15. Deegen: A JIT-Capable VM Generator for Dynamic Languages (67 points | 10 comments)
16. Evidence of oldest known alphabetic writing unearthed in ancient Syrian city (319 points | 234 comments)
17. Judge Rules in Favor of School That Gave Student a Bad Grade for Using AI (34 points | 39 comments)
18. Open-interpreter: A natural language interface for computers (36 points | 6 comments)
19. Bocker: Docker implemented in around 100 lines of Bash (2015) (342 points | 94 comments)
20. Jiga (YC W21) Is Hiring Operations Coordinator ( | hide)
21. The Flavour of Mechanisation (10 points | 1 comment)
22. Senators say TSA's facial recognition program is out of control (72 points | 56 comments)
23. Which power plant does my electricity come from? (158 points | 73 comments)
24. New study shows: EV batteries last much longer than expected (33 points | 8 comments)
25. How to give a senior leader feedback without getting fired (344 points | 296 comments)
26. Ubitium is developing 'universal' processor combining CPU, GPU, DSP, and FPGA (15 points | 4 comments)
27. Undersea Cables Connect the Global Internet (45 points | 21 comments)
28. Italian supervolcano "Phlegraean Fields" is showing signs of waking up (19 points | 2 comments)
29. Volunteer DEF CON hackers dive into America's leaky water infrastructure (29 points | 10 comments)
30. Tweaking non-neural brain cells can cause memories to fade (24 points | 2 comments)
